info.description: Read transaction list of an account
info.title: BG PSD2 ACCOUNT TRANSACTION LIST API

get.description:
Read transaction reports or transaction lists of a given account ddressed by "account-id", depending on the steering parameter 
"bookingStatus" together with balances.

For a given account, additional parameters are e.g. the attributes "dateFrom" and "dateTo". 
The ASPSP might add balance information, if transaction lists without balances are not supported.

parameters.name: account-id
parameters.description:
This identification is denoting the addressed account. 
The account-id is retrieved by using a "Read Account List" call. 
The account-id is the "id" attribute of the account structure. 
Its value is constant at least throughout the lifecycle of a given consent.

parameters.name: bookingStatus
parameters.description:
Permitted codes are 
  * "booked",
  * "pending" and 
  * "both"
"booked" shall be supported by the ASPSP.
To support the "pending" and "both" feature is optional for the ASPSP, 
Error code if not supported in the online banking frontend

parameters.name: X-Request-ID
parameters.description: ID of the request, unique to the call, as determined by the initiating party.

parameters.name: Consent-ID
parameters.description: This then contains the consentId of the related AIS consent, which was performed prior to this payment initiation.

parameters.name: dateFrom
parameters.description:
Conditional: Starting date (inclusive the date dateFrom) of the transaction list, mandated if no delta access is required.

For booked transactions, the relevant date is the booking date. 

For pending transactions, the relevant date is the entry date, which may not be transparent 
neither in this API nor other channels of the ASPSP.

parameters.name: dateTo
parameters.description:
End date (inclusive the data dateTo) of the transaction list, default is "now" if not given. 

Might be ignored if a delta function is used.

For booked transactions, the relevant date is the booking date. 

For pending transactions, the relevant date is the entry date, which may not be transparent 
neither in this API nor other channels of the ASPSP.

parameters.name: entryReferenceFrom
parameters.description:
This data attribute is indicating that the AISP is in favour to get all transactions after 
the transaction with identification entryReferenceFrom alternatively to the above defined period. 
This is a implementation of a delta access. 
If this data element is contained, the entries "dateFrom" and "dateTo" might be ignored by the ASPSP 
if a delta report is supported.

Optional if supported by API provider.

parameters.name: deltaList
parameters.description:
This data attribute is indicating that the AISP is in favour to get all transactions after the last report access for this PSU on the addressed account. This is another implementation of a delta access-report.
This delta indicator might be rejected by the ASPSP if this function is not supported.
Optional if supported by API provider

parameters.name: withBalance
parameters.description:
If contained, this function reads the list of accessible payment accounts including the booking balance, 
if granted by the PSU in the related consent and available by the ASPSP. 
This parameter might be ignored by the ASPSP.

parameters.name: Digest
parameters.description: Is contained if and only if the "Signature" element is contained in the header of the request.

parameters.name: Signature
parameters.description: A signature of the request by the TPP on application level. This might be mandated by ASPSP.

parameters.name: TPP-Signature-Certificate
parameters.description:
The certificate used for signing the request, in base64 encoding. 
Must be contained if a signature is contained.

parameters.name: PSU-IP-Address
parameters.description:
The forwarded IP Address header field consists of the corresponding HTTP request 
IP Address field between PSU and TPP. 
It shall be contained if and only if this request was actively initiated by the PSU.

parameters.name: PSU-IP-Port
parameters.description: The forwarded IP Port header field consists of the corresponding HTTP request IP Port field between PSU and TPP, if available.

parameters.name: PSU-Accept
parameters.description: The forwarded IP Accept header fields consist of the corresponding HTTP request Accept header fields between PSU and TPP, if available.

parameters.name: PSU-Accept-Charset
parameters.description: The forwarded IP Accept header fields consist of the corresponding HTTP request Accept header fields between PSU and TPP, if available.

parameters.name: PSU-Accept-Encoding
parameters.description: The forwarded IP Accept header fields consist of the corresponding HTTP request Accept header fields between PSU and TPP, if available.

parameters.name: PSU-Accept-Language
parameters.description: The forwarded IP Accept header fields consist of the corresponding HTTP request Accept header fields between PSU and TPP, if available.

parameters.name: PSU-User-Agent
parameters.description: The forwarded Agent header field of the HTTP request between PSU and TPP, if available.

parameters.name: PSU-Http-Method
parameters.description:
HTTP method used at the PSU ? TPP interface, if available.
Valid values are:
* GET
* POST
* PUT
* PATCH
* DELETE

parameters.name: PSU-Device-ID
parameters.description:
UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) for a device, which is used by the PSU, if available.
UUID identifies either a device or a device dependant application installation.
In case of an installation identification this ID need to be unaltered until removal from device.

parameters.name: PSU-Geo-Location
parameters.description: The forwarded Geo Location of the corresponding http request between PSU and TPP if available.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Is contained only, if an OAuth2 based authentication was performed in a pre-step or an OAuth2 based SCA was performed in the related consent authorisation

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The TPP can indicate the formats of account reports supported together with a priorisation following the HTTP header definition.

valueDate.description: The Date at which assets become available to the account owner in case of a credit.

transactionId.description:
the Transaction Id can be used as access-ID in the API, where more details on an transaction is offered. 
If this data attribute is provided this shows that the AIS can get access on more details about this 
transaction using the GET Transaction Details Request

exchangeRate.description: The exchange rate of the transaction if the transaction is a cross currency transaction

mandateId.description: Identification of Mandates, e.g. a SEPA Mandate ID.

bookingDate.description: The Date when an entry is posted to an account on the ASPSPs books.

entryReference.description:
Is the identification of the transaction as used e.g. for reference for deltafunction on application level. 
The same identification as for example used within camt.05x messages.

creditorId.description: Identification of Creditors, e.g. a SEPA Creditor ID.

valueDate.description: The Date at which assets become available to the account owner in case of a credit.

transactionId.description:
the Transaction Id can be used as access-ID in the API, where more details on an transaction is offered. 
If this data attribute is provided this shows that the AIS can get access on more details about this 
transaction using the GET Transaction Details Request

exchangeRate.description: The exchange rate of the transaction if the transaction is a cross currency transaction

mandateId.description: Identification of Mandates, e.g. a SEPA Mandate ID.

bookingDate.description: The Date when an entry is posted to an account on the ASPSPs books.

entryReference.description:
Is the identification of the transaction as used e.g. for reference for deltafunction on application level. 
The same identification as for example used within camt.05x messages.

creditorId.description: Identification of Creditors, e.g. a SEPA Creditor ID.

tppMessages.description: Messages to the TPP on operational issues.
